clinical_study.brief_title: Accuracy of Pre-existing Risk Scoring Models for Predicting Acute Kidney Injury in Patients Who Underwent Aortic Surgery Using a Gray Zone Approach
clinical_study.official_title: Accuracy of Pre-existing Risk Scoring Models for Predicting Acute Kidney Injury in Patients Who Underwent Aortic Surgery Using a Gray Zone Approach

brief_summary.textblock: Acute kidney injury after cardiac surgery has been reported to increase morbidity and mortality. Several risk scoring models for prediction of aortic kidney injury after cardiac surgery have been developed. However, predictive accuracy of these models is stil unclear. The aim of this study is to evaluate the accuracy of four pre-existing prediction models using a gray zone approach in patients who underwent aortic surgery in our institution.

detailed_description.textblock: Acute kidney injury after cardiac surgery has been reported to increase morbidity and mortality. Several risk scoring models for prediction of aortic kidney injury after cardiac surgery have been developed. However, predictive accuracy of these models is stil unclear. The aim of this study is to evaluate the accuracy of four pre-existing prediction models (AKICS, Wijeysundera, Mehta, and Thakar model)using a gray zone approach in patients who underwent aortic surgery in our institution. Based on receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curve analysis, we will construct a gray zone using the cut-off values with a sensitivity of < 90%, and a specificity of < 90% (diagnostic tolerance of 10%).

primary_outcome.description: abrupt (within 48 hours) reduction in kidney function currently defined as absolute increase in serum creatinine of more than or equal to 0.3 mg/dl (≥ 26.4 μmol/l), a percentage increase in serum creatinine of more than or equal to 50% (1.5-fold from baseline), or a reduction in urine output (documented oliguria of less than 0.5 ml/kg per hour for more than six hours)

secondary_outcome.measure: Gray zone range of each risk scoring model
secondary_outcome.description: Thresholds with as a sensitivity of < 90% and a specificity of < 90%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients in the gray zone
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients in the gray zone in each risk scoring model

arm_group.description: Patients who underwent aortic surgery in Samsung Medical Center during the period between 2004 and 2010

intervention.intervention_name: elective or emergency aortic surgery (including ascending, arch, descending thoracic aorta)

study_pop.textblock: Those who underwent elective or emergency aortic surgery in Samsung Medical Center during between 2004 and 2010.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Those who underwent elective or emergency aortic surgery in Samsung Medical Center during between 2004 and 2010.
Exclusion Criteria:
- missing laboratory data
- preoperative hemodialysis
- death during or within 48 hours after surgery
